section_text: 1 This Act may be cited as the Libraries Offences Act 1898.

2 Any person who, in any library or reading-room to which this Act applies, to the annoyance or disturbance of any person using the same,— 1 behaves in a disorderly manner; 2 uses violent, abusive, or obscene language; 3 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 4 or who, after proper warning, persists in remaining therein beyond the hours fixed for the closing of such library or reading-room, shall be liable on summary conviction to a penalty not exceeding  level 1 on the standard scale .

3 This Act shall apply— a . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  b to any library or reading-room maintained by a Society that is a registered society within the meaning of the Co-operative and Community Benefit Societies Act 2014, or is registered  under the  Friendly Societies Act 1974,  or by any registered Trade Union.
4 This Act shall not apply to Scotland or Ireland.
